creator: bugzilla@dougweb.org
text:
I realise this is probably the wrong place, but I don't know where the right place is.

I'd like to use a VC9 version of PHP as it's faster than versions compiled with VC6, but I'm currently unable to do so without downloading Apache from a 3rd party source, or working out how to compile things for myself.

Thanks in advance

We release source code and not binaries. So any binaries are a courtesy to the users. So I will close this report. Nevertheless the following two links should help you a lot to compile things by yourself:

http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/en/platform/win_compiling.html
http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/patches_applied/
creator: rpluem@apache.org
